p: The outbreak of COVID-19 spread far faster than before around the world. As of 11 February 2020, there have been 43,118 laboratory-confirmed cases of novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infected pneumonia (NCIP) worldwide, with 1,018 deaths [ 7]. Cases have been reported from 14 Asian countries, nine European countries, two North American countries and one country in Oceania. There have been 1017 deaths in China and 1 in the Philippines outside of China [ 7]. All reported cases have been confirmed by real-time reverse transcriptase-polymerase chain reaction [ 8, 9].
